Event.name: Crime_scenario
Event.definition:
<def-root>A (putative) <fen>Crime</fen> is committed and comes to the attention of the <fen>Authorities</fen>. In response, there is a Criminal_investigation and (often) Arrest and criminal court proceedings. The Investigation, Arrest, and other parts of the Criminal_Process are pursued in order to find a <fen>Suspect</fen> (who then may enter the Criminal_process to become the Defendant) and determine if this <fen>Suspect</fen> matches the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> of the <fen>Crime</fen>, and also to determine if the <fen>Charge</fen>s match the <fen>Crime</fen>. If the <fen>Suspect</fen> is deemed to have committed the <fen>Crime</fen>, then they are generally given some punishment commensurate with the <fen>Charge</fen>s.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Suspect
Arg.definition: <def-root>The individual which is under suspicion of having committed the <fen>Crime</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Crime
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act, generally intentional, that matches the description that belongs to an official <fen>Charge</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Charge
Arg.definition: <def-root>A description of a type of act that is not permissable according to the law of society.</def-root>

Arg.name: Authorities
Arg.definition: <def-root>The group which is responsible for the maintenance of law and order, and as such have been given the power to investigate <fen>Crime</fen>s, find <fen>Suspect</fen>s and determine if a <fen>Suspect</fen> should be submitted to the Criminal_process.</def-root>
